conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D, E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Outlet A is located at the top left, outlet B is in the middle, and outlet C is at the top right. Containers D, E, F, and G are at the bottom.
There are baffles of different colors: cyan, green, red, yellow, and white, positioned at various angles between the outlets and containers.
Liquid from outlet A is deflected by the first cyan baffle toward the left.
Liquid from outlet A is then guided downward by the next two baffles.
Liquid from outlet A finally reaches container D.
Liquid from outlet B travels almost straight down.
Liquid from outlet B encounters the central red baffle and is directed rightward.
Liquid from outlet B is deflected again and ends up in container F.
Liquid from outlet C initially moves rightward.
Liquid from outlet C is redirected downward by the yellow and white baffles.
Liquid from outlet C finally enters container G.
